edge: In 1985, Jim Henson and director Steve Barron approached Walt Disney Pictures with the idea of a live-action version of Pinocchio, but Disney turned down the project. On April 8, 2015, it was announced that Walt Disney Pictures was developing a live-action adaptation of the 1940 animated film Pinocchio.

In 1985, Jim Henson and director Steve Barron approached Walt Disney Pictures with the idea of a live-action version of Pinocchio, directed by Robert Zemeckis (left), but Disney turned down the project.
In April 8, 2015, it was announced that Walt Disney Pictures was developing a live-action adaptation of the 1940 animated film Pinocchio, with screenwriter Peter Hedges.
On May 22, 2017, it was announced that Chris Weitz would replace Hedges as a screenwriter, as well as serve as a producer, for the live-action adaptation of Pinocchio.
On May 22, 2017, it was announced that Chris Weitz would replace Hedges as a screenwriter, and director Sam Mendes was in talks to direct the project.
On February 20, 2018, it was announced that Paul King was set to direct the film, with co-producer Andrew Milano.

node_2: production in england and italy during 2019
edge: On February 20, 2018, it was announced that Paul King was set to direct the film, with production expected to begin in late 2018 in England and Italy during 2019.
In November 2018, Simon Farnaby was reported to have worked on a new draft for the film.
In November 2018, Simon Farnaby was reported to have worked on a new draft for the film at Disney.
In January 2019, it was reported that King left the film due to 'family reasons' while Disney was announced to be searching for a new director for the project.
On October 18, 2019, it was reported that Robert Zemeckis was in talks to direct the film for Disney.
Tom Hanks (left), Cynthia Erivo, Giuseppe Battiston and Luke Evans play Geppetto, The Blue Fairy, Stromboli and The Coachman.
Hanks passed on the project after King's departure.

Hanks reportedly reached out to director Robert Zemeckis for the role of Geppetto after reading the script; the two have previously worked together in the films Forrest Gump (1994), Cast Away (2000), and The Polar Express (2004).
Joseph Gordon-Levitt (left), Keegan-Michael Key and Lorraine Bracco voice Jiminy Cricket, 'Honest' John Worthington Foulfellow and Sofia the Seagull.
